description: The RCMP logo is seen in Surrey, B.C., in a file photo. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)
title: ‘Close Associate’ of Quebec Gang Leader Arrested by BC RCMP

description: A Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) sign is seen in Calgary on Aug. 1, 2019. (Jeff McIntosh/The Canadian Press)
title: Feds Speed Up Removal of Smugglers, Firearm Offenders at Border

description: A person looks at their cell phone displaying a Rogers service interruption alert in Montreal on July 8, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Graham Hughes)
title: Employee Error During Upgrade Behind Rogers 2022 Wireless Outage

description: Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer speaks during a press conference after his first Cabinet meeting at 10 Downing Street, London, on July 6, 2024. (Claudia Greco/PA Wire)
title: Starmer Says Rwanda Policy Is ‘Dead and Buried’

description: Thousands of people and the families of hostages hold up their cellphones with the torch light on to sing the national anthem during the “50 Days of Hell” rally in support of the 212 hostages that are still being held by Hamas, as another 13 Israeli hostages are expected to be released from Gaza, during the second day of the temporary truce, in Tel Aviv, Israel, on Nov. 25, 2023. (Alexi J. Rosenfeld/Getty Images)
title: Protesters Rally in Tel Aviv, Calling for the Release of Israeli Hostages in Gaza

description: The Royal Courts of Justice building, which houses the High Court of England and Wales, in London on Feb. 3, 2017. (Daniel Leal/AFP via Getty Images)
title: High Court Deems Rwanda Guidance Lawful as Tories Lose Election

description: A woman paddles a specially adapted paddleboard on False Creek as a person sits in a wheelchair in Vancouver, on July 3, 2024. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)
title: Environment Canada Issues Widespread Warnings as Intense Heatwave Settles Over BC

description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting (R) with Science Secretary Peter Kyle (L), leaving 10 Downing Street in London, on July 6, 2024. (Tejas Sandhu/PA Wire)
title: New Health Secretary Wes Streeting Says NHS Is ‘Broken’

description:
Left: Newly elected British Prime Minister Keir Starmer greets Labour campaigners and activists at No. 10 Downing Street in London on July 5, 2024. (Toby Melville/Reuters)
Right: U.S. President Joe Biden speaks to the media at the White House in Washington on July 1, 2024. (Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
title: Biden Congratulates Starmer, Affirms US-UK ‘Special Relationship’

description: Reform UK leader and MP for Clacton Nigel Farage (L), with Reform UK chairman and MP for Boston and Skegness Richard Tice (C), and Reform UK MP for Ashfield, Lee Anderson (R), during a press conference in Westminster, central London on July 5, 2024. (Tejas Sandhu/PA Wire)
title: Reform UK Wins 5th Seat After Recount in Basildon South and Thurrock

description: Canada's Ismaël Kenneth Jordan Koné (8) scores against Venezuela goalkeeper Rafael Romo in a shootout to win a Copa America quarterfinal soccer match between Venezuela and Canada, on July 5, 2024, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez)
title: Canada Beats Venezuela to Reach Semifinals in First Copa America

description: Researchers found that ultra-processed food like frozen meal and soft drinks are associated with increased risk of depression. (Benjamin Chasteen/The Epoch Times)
title: Appetite for Sugar Tax to Fight Diabetes and Obesity

description: A supplied screen grab take on July 2, 2024 showing smoke at the Grosvenor Coal Mine near Moranbah in Queensland. Authorities are concerned the burning shafts at the coal mine could lead to an explosion. (AAP Image/Supplied by ABC News)
title: Pay Relief for Workers After Blaze Shuts Coal Mine

description: A small group of children play at the Robertson Street Kindy Childcare Centre in Helensburgh south of Sydney, Australia, on April 3, 2020. (AAP Image/Dean Lewins)
title: Preschool Teachers Push for Pay, Parents Get Fee Relief

description: National Fried Chicken Day is observed annually on July 6. (Shutterstock/Graphixo13)
title: Here’s the Restaurant Pecking Order for National Fried Chicken Day

description: The Lamborghini Gallardo LP 570-4  at a press preview in Tokyo on Sept. 20, 2013. (Kazuhiro Nogi /AFP/Getty Images)
title: New Licence Class for High-Powered Vehicles

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban speaks during the closing rally of his electoral campaign in Szekesfehervar, Hungary, on April 1, 2022. (Marton Monus/ Reuters)
title: Hungary’s Orban Meets Putin in Push for Diplomacy on Russia-Ukraine War

description: Ambulance attendants wearing full protective clothing prepare a gurney to transport residents to hospital at the Wyoming Nursing Home on August 2, 2021 in Sydney, Australia. The Wyoming Nursing Home in Sydney's inner west, run by Hardi Aged Care, has reported 18 Covid-19 cases in residents and a further two in staff, sending the remainder of the home's top floor residents to hospital as a precaution. Covid-19 lockdown restrictions in hot spot local government areas have increased with masks required outdoors at all times and residents limited to movement within a 5 kilometre radius of their homes. Greater Sydney is in lockdown through August 28th to contain the highly contagious Covid-19 delta variant. (Photo by Sean Foster/Getty Images)
title: Knife Taken to Government Agency That Helped Handle Pandemic
